website_summaries.verdict: A durable workhorse with all the features students and financial pros need - for a reasonable price.
pros: Comes with a hard case for protection
Has 9 variable memories and solar power to back up batteries
cons: Some people have a hard time reading the screen

customer_reviews.title: 11 YEARS!
customer_reviews.text: My parent's bought me this model calculator when I started 6th grade (2006). I used it for every Math class, every year, until I finished my undergraduate. The battery just gave in early 2017. That's incredible to me. I loved it. I still need a calculator every so often, so I purchased the same model.
customer_reviews.author: JML

customer_reviews.title: Top-notch scientific calculators
customer_reviews.text: I'm a high school math teacher, and we usually use graphing calculators like the TI-84, but those are over $100 each, and many of my students can't afford one, nor can I afford to buy a class set. These Casio scientific calcs are just fine for 90% of what we do, so I bought 10 of them to let students use them if they don't have a graphing calc. They are really top-notch scientific calcs. By the way, I do NOT recommend the Casio graphing calcs such as the Casio fx-9750. On first glance, they look comparable to the TI-84s, but they are inferior and students who buy them are usually disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alan RC

customer_reviews.title: Seemed a great deal for scientific calculator until I used it
customer_reviews.text: The screen is unreadable unless you are directly over it. Seemed a great deal for scientific calculator until I used it. Working with it on a desk you can't see the numbers unless you are directly over it, almost perpendicular to the screen. This means that after entering something you have to pick it up and tilt it towards you in order to read it or use it in an almost vertical position. When not directly over the screen, all you can see are the "8888s" and lcd modules, not your numbers/calculations. Very disappointing for a Casio product. It will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: it's always good to have a few extra on hand
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced scientific calculators. I use them for teaching chemistry classes. Since calculators have a habit of wandering off occasionally, it's always good to have a few extra on hand. At least this style won't make you go broke if you have to get a couple of them. It's nice and easy to use. It won't graph, but it will do most basic things needed for an intro chemistry course. (log functions, etc) BTW, it took me a while to figure out how to switch modes. I wish they made that a little more intuitive but it's still a decent calculator.
customer_reviews.author: sci teacher

customer_reviews.title: Own same one for 19yrs and still works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Happy to see they still make this !!!! I bought the same calculator 19 years ago when I was in college in a store. I used it all through college and still use the same one almost daily 19 years later ! My kids even used it in high school. It's better than the expensive ones and does just as much. It's the most reliable and amazing calculator. Still works like the day I bought it !!! I'm so glad I found another, they don't make products like this anymore ! Highly recommend!!!!! I had to buy another to leave at work.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Scientific Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I already knew I loved this product when I bought it, because it's the exact model of the one I lost and needed to replace! This calculator is fantastic, affordable, and has everything a biochemistry major who can't bring a graphing calc to an exam could need. The exponents, logs, and stat tests are all easy to use (though, you will need to read the manual for the stat tests) and the solar power works great. This is my favorite calculator, and has served me well through my college years. It's super durable, and the only reason I need to replace it is because I lost my other one (a very sad day).
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love the functions!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for a statics class and our teacher taught us some very cool functions, such as how to use it to reduce fractions! Oh, how I wish I had had this thing years ago to help with that! The only downside is that you have to view the panel almost straight on in order to see it. Any more than a slight tilt and all you see are the LCD lines, making it unreadable. I have calculators that I have received for free that are more easily viewable at an angle. If Casio were to fix that minor issue, it would be a 5 star item for sure.
customer_reviews.author: kda949

customer_reviews.title: Hard to see numbers unless you hold calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator has all the useful functions but you can not read the display when it is lying flat on a table or desk. You have to pick it up or be directly on top of the readout to see the number. Most test do not allow you to pick up a calculator during exams so if you are buying this for that reason, do not buy this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Pasnik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for my 1980s Casio fx-115M calculator
customer_reviews.text: In the late 1980s I purchased a Casio fx-115M. It served me without fail until 2018 -- roughly three decades -- when it finally gave up the ghost. I nabbed this Casio model and I'm perfectly happy with it. I like the hard plastic cover: just flip it over and it acts as a superhero cape. The sturdy plastic gives it a lightweight feel compared to the old model's aluminum body. The new plastic body feels tough; I expect it will last a loooooong time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Rosenberger

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: This calculator sometimes makes mistakes for some reason even with the easy one step problems. I realized that so I quit using it. I couldn’t take a picture for the” ln e” value since I was in the test and how an easy problem became odd. In fact I knew the value is 1 but I was trying to make sure since I am anxious while taking the test like any student.
customer_reviews.author: asi

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and functional
customer_reviews.text: Without delving into the specifics, this calculator is awesome and has definitely served it's purpose. All the functions work as they should, it has a small solar cell, so there is no need to worry about buying batteries, and it has a cover to provide protection when not in use. Overall I'd buy this again if I needed to, and I would recommend this to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: F. Caldera

customer_reviews.title: KNOCKOFF!! 95% UNUSABLE!! NOT REAL; AVOID!!
customer_reviews.text: These aren't real; a guy at work has a real one that is 10years old and works better than these. The display on these are virtually unreadable. You can only make out what the display shows if you are looking at it straight on. It is completely trash avoid at all cost. You can get a better calulator at Walmart for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Truax

customer_reviews.title: College requirement for my daughter - but works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a freshman in college and a "calculator" like this is a requirement; however, she tried out a number of her friends other brands or models and they all decided they really liked hers best. I'm just passing this review on from her, as I feel old enough to have used an abacus when I was last in math class!
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I needed for my math class that does not allow algebra systems and my chemistry and engineering classes that use large numbers! It works fantastic. I read about not being able to see the screen at certain angles on other reviews, and its true, but its not a big deal. I just pick it up or slightly move my head... also, the keys are a little loose but it has no affect on how well it works. And I do have to double check everything I am typing in, but I do that with all calculators to catch typos so I don't know what the big deal is.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, cheap, and it does fractions!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my workshop so I could avoid an accident with my "good" calculator. The calculator way exceeded my expectations. Things I particularly like is that it comes with a hard cover that turns into a back when in use. And it does fractions! Seriously, you can add and subtract fractional inches and get answers in fractions. For somebody stuck in a wood shop that uses fractional inches, this feature is a godsend.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Chem for Health Sciences
customer_reviews.text: Got me through my chemistry class no problem. The buttons were the same or very similar to all the ones my professor described in their lecture videos. Got a lot of use out of the calculator so far. I jam on the buttons sometimes out of frustration, and the thing hasn't broken yet. Really satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: ... I have to say the building quality is much worse compared with my first one which still functions perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: this is my second one of the same calculator and it works the same but I have to say the building quality is much worse compared with my first one which still functions perfectly which was bought ten years ago. the buttons of the new one was shaky and you can see obvious gaps below the keys... the battery lasts really really long due to the solar panel.
customer_reviews.author: cailiqingsheng

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this specifically for my SATs and it was perfect! I only had a couple days beforehand to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my SATs and it was perfect! I only had a couple days beforehand to get used to using it (which I don't recommend btw, my lack of prep caused so much stress) but it was simple and easy to figure out and use. The calculator functions well and can do everything you'd expect from a scientific calculator. The screen display is clear and the info it provides is really helpful when backtracking on a problem. Overall I'm really glad I chose this calculator and will definitely use it in the future!
customer_reviews.author: NaturalGirl71

customer_reviews.title: The calculator stopped working after 2 months. This was ...
customer_reviews.text: The calculator stopped working after 2 months. This was purchased for my daughter who is in 7th grade so she doesn't even use it that often. We thought we would get something she can use through middle and high school and it didn't last through a sememster. The calculator was not droppd or loaned out so we know there was no damage or impact that could have caused it to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Bearden Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Works well and "streaming " of entries helps locate (and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and "streaming " of entries helps locate (and correct) any errors. The display uses 7 segment method for character formation. Therefore, a small backwards "L" substitutes for a sloping fraction bar in fractional mode. You can get used to it but it still looks strange.
customer_reviews.author: Mai Vyou

customer_reviews.title: it served me in good stead. In fact
customer_reviews.text: Seven years ago, I bought a Casio FX-300MS for high school math. From then on through undergrad, it served me in good stead. In fact, I never even had to change the battery. I've used this calculator for everything from accountancy to econometrics. Then, last year, I moved for grad school and left it behind. So when I needed a calculator a few weeks ago I bought the same model, and it's just as good as I remembered. Delivery was prompt, it's in great shape, and I'm sure I'll be able to use this one for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Janina

customer_reviews.title: ... one of these calculators in tech School and I loved it. Years later
customer_reviews.text: I first got one of these calculators in tech School and I loved it. Years later, I still use it, but i needed another to keep at my (office+workshop) i love how easy and quick and simple it is to do even more complex formulas and equations. The layout is intuitive and the response is quick and it comes at a great price! It's Kind of Perfect. (Arguably)
customer_reviews.author: wheelyboard

customer_reviews.title: Best school math calculator ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love these calculators. They have just the functions needed for all high school and college math courses, in the simplest to use calculator possible. Oh, and I paid only $6 for mine. Its not s graphing calculator, but apps are better for that.
customer_reviews.author: minimalist

customer_reviews.title: great for high school
customer_reviews.text: This has been my kids favorite calculator. They are in AP classes and it has the functions they need. They have recommended this model to others to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Payne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to have to spend $100+ for a calculator for my daughter. For the incredible price of this one I thought we’d give it a shot. It’s great! Works just as well as the very pricey ones I bought years ago for my oldest.
customer_reviews.author: Hot mama

customer_reviews.title: Good for school
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for school and it has been a great attachment for her studies so overall it is good to have. I would surely recommend this keep little display doesn't bother you
customer_reviews.author: Kapil Kanojia

customer_reviews.title: For all those that need nCr and nPr functions, look no further.
customer_reviews.text: All I needed was a calculator that had nCr and nPr functions that wasn't upwards of $100. This calculator satisfies those requirements. It does all a basic calculator needs to do, and capable of permutations and combinations if you're in a very basic stats course (or discrete mathematics, like I was at the time of purchasing this). It was surprising to me how many calculators didn't have those 2 functions, but thankfully this calculator did and performed them correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and pretty rugged
customer_reviews.text: I use the calculator in my machining shop, it works well, seems pretty rugged and thanks to the cover that slips over the front it is protected from steel shavings and dust so I dont need to keep it always far from where i work making thing easier for me
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Masolini

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I was looking for.. It's very easy to carry to exams and can solve very complex problems as well.. Doesn't support High end matrix problems but it's effective for undergrad level mathematics and linear algebra
customer_reviews.author: Manjish

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price for a great scientific calculator
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price for a great scientific calculator. I bought it mainly for the Log function. I've had no problems with it. It's just very dependable. The protector shield slides off, and you can slide it underneath the calculator, or you can just leave the shield off completely.
customer_reviews.author: kkrome25

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to use and has better functions
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a calculator in middle school but couldn't afford the 30$ TI they wanted us to get so I got this. It was easy to use and has better functions. One thing I like is that you can go back into a problem and edit it instead of rewriting it. I bought this for college after my original wore out after 9+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Casey J.

customer_reviews.title: Best day-to-day calculator ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most useful calculator there is for engineering. The functions are convenient, it is very easy to use, and you never have to worry about batteries. I have four of these, one for every desk and table I work at. Can't beat the value.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T Gebelein

customer_reviews.title: It performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, i think all calculators are the same. As long as it doesn’t fail you during the exams, then it’s good. My daughter said so, she’s satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lazaro

customer_reviews.title: Best thing about this calculator is that it arrived in ...
customer_reviews.text: Best thing about this calculator is that it arrived in my daughters stocking on Christmas morning! Her expression was priceless. Just what she wanted - a calculator for math class! This was teacher recommended so I will assume it does all the functions you need in 7th grade math - who remembers any of that stuff anyway. And she uses it - and it hasn't broken yet so thats a plus. Then again, I still have my first edition solar powered casio from the 70's and it is still going strong - so two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: TLee

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Nice little calculator. Exactly what I needed for my math class. You can't beet the price for this quality. The plastic feels a little cheap, but not overly so. As I said, great deal for the price. My old Casio I (unfortunately) left back home in Europe felt much sturdier and the plastic was of better quality, but it cost me much more than this little baby, so no reason to complain. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase and product.
customer_reviews.author: MilaGrace

customer_reviews.title: Works great like my old one!
customer_reviews.text: I had the same calculator when I was in highschool. So when I was looking for one when I moved to america, I wanted the same thing again. When it arrived worked well like how I remembered it. Battery is great, hoping this lasts for years like mine did.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Statistics (Math 10)
customer_reviews.text: I've never needed one of these, so it's still a little confusing on how to use it. However, completely necessary for statistics class (Math 10 in Community College). Makes math problems go from 45 minutes to do, down to about a couple of minutes. Mine came in perfectly new condition, in packaging. Shipment took 2 days and I was pleased. Thank you very much!
customer_reviews.author: L Quezada

customer_reviews.title: Casio fx-300MS Scientific Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Casio fx-300MS Scientific Calculator more advance than what I needed but nicer than a basic calculator. just wanted something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Easy Calculator to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have six of these Casio Fx-300MS Scientific Calculators in my classroom. I have found that this calculator is easy for students to learn and use. It can do fractions, exponents and square root functions, among other things. It is NOT a graphing calculator, but should be useful for a student working on algebra or pre-algebra.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Casio fx-300MS
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Casio fx-300MS calculator because my other calculators were worn out and making keying errors. Scientific and financial calculators are so cheap in the 21st century that you can buy a decent unit for less than the cost of the batteries. The Casio fx-300MS is an excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple, yet reliable calculator—all I could ask for. It’s thin and light, so it’s easy to carry in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Markle

customer_reviews.title: Much better and more intuitive than Texas Instruments calculators
customer_reviews.text: Much better and more intuitive than Texas Instruments calculators. This baby has gotten me through my undergrad (chemistry, biology, physics and the like) very readily and has never failed. I lost the first one I had so I had to buy another. The only complaint for me is that I couldn't get the first one I had to work without solar power...the battery must have died inside but the screws were stripped so I couldn't replace them. Great calculator!
customer_reviews.author: zw

customer_reviews.title: I bought a bunch of these and donated them to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch of these and donated them to a school in Africa. If you are going to do the same thing, make sure you get the solar operated ones so they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: thechoop

customer_reviews.title: Great at any price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a calculator quickly for class so I bought an off brand at a walk in store for 3x the price of this very reliable Casio. The off brand was cheap to the point of the 7 key working sometimes, which messed up a test. Then it died in the middle of another test due to the case buckling - junk! I bought the Casio, it arrived fast and it was rock solid. It lasted all semester, is still good as new, and was easy to use for a third of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great Calculator for a Great Price! For those having some trouble with the contrast (viewing angle), try this. Press MODE,MODE,MODE,MODE,2. Then press the left arrow until the screen clears up for you. The screen is 100 times better with the contrast turned way down.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: My favorite calculator ever
customer_reviews.text: My favorite calculator ever. An awesome calculator with just what you need not to much bit no to little. It shows both the equations and the answer on the screen. I decadently left mine at home so I bought a TI-30Xa and I was so frustrated with it that I rather would use my phone calculator, but it still was extremely frustrating using it for chem so I gave in and bought another one from amazon because I couldn't wait 10+ days it would take to ship my old calculator from home. Amazon has this calculator for a great price and 2 day shipping to get it before my chem homework was due.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Scientific Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Perfect calculator for simple scientific equations. I used this calculator from Algebra to Calculus and it held up well and performed as expected. I actually misplaced my original which I had from 6th grade to senior year (so roughly seven years) but that one had never died so I expect my current one to last the same amount of time. If you're looking for a reliable, cheap calculator, this is a very strong choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought his product for my son, he is in secondary School. He likes it. It works well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: i liked that one becuase the edges were completely straight so ...
customer_reviews.text: casio made a similar one that was strictly battery powered...i liked that one becuase the edges were completely straight so it made it easy to draw a graph or a straight line...this one is a bit difficult. but serves its function.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for my moddle school Grandson. I ordered it here as it was not available in the area. It came quickly and arrived in excellent shape. It also had a protective cover. He said it is easy to use and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M.

customer_reviews.title: The classic is always the best
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't been said before? This calculator offers a wide range of functionality, is easy to use and stylish. It's also quite cheap compared to other calculators. This is an awesome calculator. Would buy again. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Saqibul Chowdhury

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and good deal. It seems like this calcilator os cheaper but in good quality. I like ot.
customer_reviews.author: MaddeD

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this !!! I get the product like two years ago when I stared my colleges, and I am still using it. It could handle everything up to calculus. It also really useful in calculus for the algebra part. Also, it is solar powered, which saves me a lot
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great price & product
customer_reviews.text: GREAT price & product, helped my wife pass some VERY hard courses in college. OUTSTANDING value can't find it cheaper or better anywhere else but here on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: T. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, however some of the buttons seem a bit flimsy to me. They are tilted and I'm scared that a button will come out soon even though I just recently got it about 2 weeks ago. Hopefully nothing will happen
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: but I like the calculator
customer_reviews.text: Clearing the display seems to use a different combination of keys than indicated. but I like the calculator, and the hard cover keeps it safe while carrying it in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, for dirt cheap. I occasionally need the 'advanced' functions, but the deal-maker for me was the fraction function. I do plenty of wood working and - old fashioned me - am still fond of the odd fractional method of measuring. I'm good up to 32nd's but I sure appreciate being able to calculate to 64ths and above. I recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: this is a good piece of hardware for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: after 15 years, my old Casio started to fritz out. battery replacement was a no go. as an engineer. i use my calculator every single day. its been a work horse for me. rather than go with a newer calculator, i purchased the exact same replacement model. this is a good piece of hardware for everyday use. if you plan on taking the FE, PE exam, this is one of the calculators that's allowed.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap solid as all Casio products IMO
customer_reviews.text: It's a good deal on a solid calculator that is to me and my kids easier to use than TI and some others. At this price the inevitable break or loss is a big so what. I remember my HP 35 years ago was like a federal crime if I broke it...! And I still never figured out half the functions.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a HP scientific calculator. The buttons are responsive and I like the dedicated ANS button to recall the most recent answer to use in a subsequent calculation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T. Donville

customer_reviews.title: Disatisifed!
customer_reviews.text: My son cannot use this calculator! The calculator does not hold the solar charge. He has to ask his teacher to borrow her calculator because his dies out. When doing HW he has to do it on the kitchen counter standing up while holding it under the light. Quite disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... "memory" so I bought a calculator that has a great sig fig button
customer_reviews.text: Chem teacher said I couldn't use a calculator with "memory" so I bought a calculator that has a great sig fig button.
customer_reviews.author: somard

customer_reviews.title: Solar calculator -- fits her needs!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my stepdaughter's math course as she needed a calculator. This was an excellent price for a good product. She has had no difficulty using it and it has all the functions she needs for her class. Even better it's powered by solar -- no batteries ever. The only thing I wish is that there was a graphic calculator at a good price as this and powered by solar as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Affordable, Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great, cheap calculator and does the job! However the only downside is the display at certain angles you sometimes can’t tell if its a “9” or “7”. I missed some questions on a college math exam due to this error.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: This calculator is good for on-the-job scientific (lab) calculations
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is good for on-the-job scientific (lab) calculations: dependable in low and with nicely sized buttons. One drawback is that it can be difficult to read the display from too great an angle (I have to look at the display more directly than with other calculators). Overall this is a minor issue and it is still well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Good Calculator but overly loose buttons
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a good calculator for the money. The two line display works well. It doesn't have the metric conversion keys that my old TI had which I miss already. The thing that I dislike the most about this calculator is the buttons. The buttons are very easy to press and don't give a nice tactile feedback. In other words, the keys are mushy. Not only that, the keys sit too loose inside the bezel. There is so much slop in the fit of the keys that they can actually look crooked. So I'm only somewhat satisfied with it and can only give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Foot

customer_reviews.title: Good  and simple
customer_reviews.text: Good ol calculator and does what it is suppose to. Cheap and works.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rappleye

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good calculator for the price! Does everything you need a Scientific calculator to do
customer_reviews.author: Louis Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great little scientific calculator
customer_reviews.text: Great little scientific calculator. Saved my butt when I needed one last minute for a college math class that wouldn't allow a graphing calculator
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: Calculator works fine, good for the price. Only problem is that I bought it to use as a desk calculator and it is almost impossible to read without picking it up and bringing it to a 90 degree angle with your vision. When you look at it from an angle all you see are 8's and black squares! If I had paid any more than I did for it I would be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Capps

customer_reviews.title: Simply love this!
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar one when i was young when i went to school and i absolutely loved it and it feels like it has not changed one bit which makes me even happier!! Its extremely easy to use, light, practical, thin and always very useful! I am very pleased and i would definitely buy this again and recommend it..:)
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Expect this to last me a while
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace almost the exact same version that finally died after about 20 years of non-continuous use. Look forward to another 20 with this gem.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Best Calculator I Have Ever Purchased
customer_reviews.text: The sending was quick! And the numbers showing on the screen is so clear to see! And all the buttons feel so comfort to touch and never make a loud sound which I find can be really annoying~ The best thing is, it has two power sources! I have used soooo many calculators, and most of them cost me more money...by far, this is the best! Believe me, Casio fx-300MS Scientific Calculator is classic!
customer_reviews.author: Shukun Yang

It was supposed to be new but I noticed that it had some writing on the back (like a marker) that looked like it had been rubbed off. I'm pretty sure I was sold a used calculator.

product_meta.title: Casio fx-300MS Scientific Calculator
product_meta.description:
Size:1 PackThe FX300MS Plus calculator features a two-line display and supports complex number calculations, algebra, calculus, and 18 levels of parentheses. Always powered up, it's just as useful in a household or office for all your calculating needs, from finances to converting cooking measurements, and for anything else you can think of when you wish you had a calculator at hand. The large, readable two-line display exhibits 10 digits, shows the problem as you write it, and then shows the answer alongside, permitting better tracking of your equation-solving process. With the Casio FX300MS, if you make an input error, you can quickly clear it with the backspace key. Tap the auto replay function to check your last equation. You can also use 229 built-in mathematics functions, enter fractions, raise y to the x power, figure standard deviations, process degree/radian/grad conversions, calculate sine, cosine, tangent, and inverse, and compute permutations and combinations. Plus, call upon the FX300MS's basic scientific, exponential, and trigonometric functions for everything you need to complete your assignments and lab work. Key in and program formulas to save for future uses. The FX300MS provides one independent and six constant memory keys. It has an efficient key layout, making this an easy-to-use basic scientific calculator, offering all the functions you'll need in a solidly constructed unit. And solar power means never replacing batteries; the backup battery assures you'll always have power when you need it.

AMAZON.COM
For math and science students at all levels and for any home or office needing to compute algebraic equations from time to time, the Casio FX300MS Plus calculator is an indispensable tool. From high school onward, in lab classes and for exams, the FX300MS features a two-line display and supports complex number calculations, algebra, calculus, and 18 levels of parentheses. Always powered up, it's just as useful in a household or office for all your calculating needs, from finances to converting cooking measurements, and for anything else you can think of when you wish you had a calculator at hand. 

The large, readable two-line display exhibits 10 digits, shows the problem as you write it, and then shows the answer alongside, permitting better tracking of your equation-solving process. With the Casio FX300MS, if you make an input error, you can quickly clear it with the backspace key. Tap the auto replay function to check your last equation. You can also use 229 built-in mathematics functions, enter fractions, raise y to the x power, figure standard deviations, process degree/radian/grad conversions, calculate sine, cosine, tangent, and inverse, and compute permutations and combinations. Plus, call upon the FX300MS's basic scientific, exponential, and trigonometric functions for everything you need to complete your assignments and lab work. Key in and program formulas to save for future uses.

The FX300MS provides one independent and six constant memory keys. It has an efficient key layout, making this an easy-to-use basic scientific calculator, offering all the functions you'll need in a solidly constructed unit. And solar power means never replacing batteries; the backup battery assures you'll always have power when you need it. --Barbara Price
